The 'hydronium' cation is the positively charged polyatomic ion with the
chemical formula . Hydronium, a type of oxonium ion, is formed by the
protonation of water (). This cation is often used to represent the nature of
the proton in aqueous solution, where the proton is highly solvated (bound to a
solvent). The reality is far more complicated, and a proton is bound to several
molecules of water, such that other descriptions such as
H 5O 2+ , H 7O 3+
and H 9O 4+ are increasingly accurate
descriptions of the environment of a proton in water. The ion
has been detected in the gas phase.
